Is the hostname correct? Press the Ping button.
Please enable remote connections by editing the pg_hba.conf file on server.
Further details in Help.

Make sure the password is correct.
Make sure the authentication method for your connection is set to md5 or scram-sha-256 instead of trust.
You can find this file in the PostgreSQL data directory. Look for lines like:
host all all 127.0.0.1/32 md5
Change the password in PSQL by executing "ALTER USER postgres PASSWORD 'newPassword'".
Details in Help.

Check the database timezone settings in postgresql.conf. They should be similar with the operating system settings.
On linux operating system settings using the 'locale' command.

Serial and Bigserial are aliases for integer and bigint with autoincrement.
Converting a column to serial will fail in the database.
You may set the column default value from a sequence, like nextval('seq_name').

This error can be caused by a timezone difference between the database server and current computer.
In Options Tab select the client Time Zone same as in the database server.

• Enable remote connections on Postgres server by editing pg_hba.conf. Press the Help for details.
  • Press 'Ping' to test the host and port. The host should be reachable also from command prompt 'ping <host>'.

advice.pattern: there is no unique constraint matching given keys
advice.message:
The referred column(s) should be primary key or have an unique index.
This is a general database design requirement.

advice.pattern: cannot drop constraint.*because other objects depend on it
advice.message:
Dropping a Primary Key or Unique index may require to drop the related Foreign Keys first.
Please drop first all foreign keys referring the involved columns.

advice.pattern: could not be verified by hostnameverifier
advice.message:
Please use 'sslmode' in the JDBC URL with one of: 'disable|allow|prefer|require|verify-ca|verify-full'.
Use 'Edit Manually' in the URL field to set a custom URL.

advice.pattern: cannot run inside a transaction block
advice.message: This require enabling auto-commit by disabling Model /Settings / Database Specific / Behavior/ Transaction / Disable Auto-Commit.

advice.pattern: there is no unique constraint matching given keys for referenced table
advice.message:
Databases require the column(s) referred by a foreign key to be primary keys or indexed unique and mandatory.
Please create first an unique index or Pk on the referred column(s).
Choose 'Edit Manually' in the JDBC URL combo and add '&readPreference=secondary' to the URL. This will allow connecting to a secondary server.

advice.pattern: The server does not support SSL
advice.message: Choose a different pattern in the JDBC URL pattern, without SSL.
